text:
88 yo female with PMH: CAD, HTN, DM, Afib, Alzheimers, anemia, GIB, s/p
   PEG placement. s/p CVA [**5-12**] on coumadin; since CVA patient has been a
   resident at rehab facilities with 1 recent hospital admission for
   treatment of PNA.
   [**8-5**]: Date of admission-found unresponsive and bradycardic at [**Hospital1 25**].
   Transferred to [**Hospital 2437**] Hospital w/ bloody mouth, INR level of 10 w/
   active upper/lower GI bleeds, subsequently transferred to [**Hospital1 5**]
   intubated on pressors. In ED; hypothermic, INR 5, HCT 20, given 2 units
   FFP, triple lumen placed in left femoral admitted to CCU as MICU
   border.
   Given 3 liters IVF, 2 units FFP & 2 units PRBC as well as dopamine gtt.
   EGD & bronchoscopy at bedside. Full Code.
   [**Date range (1) 8679**] overnight: remained on low-dose dopamine to maintain MAP > 65.
   Monitored serial HCT
s & coags, IV antibiotics. Family meeting planned
   for 1 pm with MICU service on [**8-6**].
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   Received patient on Dopamine gtt at 3 mcg/kg/min w/ NBP 89-111/70
   [s/p 3 liters IVF, 2 units FFP & 2 units PRBC
s given prior shift ]
   Action:
   Close hemodynamic monitoring [ Aline placement attempted prior shift
   for closer hemodynamic monitoring was not successful 2/2 patients
   peripheral edema]
   Dopamine gtt increased to 4 mcg/kg/min to maintain MAP
s > 65 at 20:30.
   Response:
   MAPs maintained > 65 on 4 mcg/kg/min dopamine gtt. No additional fluid
   boluses administered overnight.
   Plan:
   Continue to wean dopamine gtt with goal to maintain MAP > 65.
   Additional fluid & blood product administration per MICU service.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Baseline Cr level 1.2-1.5. Cr level 2.7 this pm. Urine yellow & cloudy.
   Action:
   UA sent. Prior shift completed Foley irrigation & administered total 3
   liters IVF in boluses given low urine output.
   Response:
   Urine output remains poor at approximately 10 ml/hr, urine remains
   couldy-yellow in coloration; UA report many bacteria. Am Cr level
   pending.
   Plan:
   Follow urine output, labs, renally dose meds. ? appropriate abx
   coverage for UTI (on IV cipro/vanc/zosyn).
   Gastrointestinal bleed, upper (Melena, GI Bleed, GIB)
   Assessment:
   Patient s/p EGD at bedside today. INR 2 from this afternoon s/p 2 units
   FFP & 2 units PRBC
s. Oral secretions tinged with dark (old-appearing
   blood).
   Action:
   Serial HCT
s collected q 6 hours. Coags monitored this evening.
   Administered IV protonix as ordered. Monitored for s/s bleeding.
   Maintained NPO status.
   Response:
   8 pm HCT level 32.3, INR 1.8. 2 am HCT level 32.3 . No BRBPR or Melena
   noted. Continues to have blood-tinged oral secretions.  EGD results
   report no sign of bleeding.
   Plan:
   Continue to follow lab levels incuding HCT, PLTS & coagulation levels.
   Continue to keep patient NPO & administer Protonix IV in [**Hospital1 **] dosing.
   Guiac stools.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Rec
d patient on vent: 40% 400 x16, 5 of PEEP. Lungs CTA bilaterally.
   Blood-tinged oral secretions suctioned frequently. Patient
   overbreathing vent by 5-8 bpm
   Action:
   RRT increased Fi 02 to 50% at start of shift. Continued with q 2 hour
   oral care & suctioning given copious oral secretions. Fentanyl gtt
   increased from 25 to 50 mcg/hr to help patient from over-breathing vent
   at 3 am. Maintained HOB @ 30 degrees. Empiric antibiotic coverage for
   potential aspiration in setting of intubation- Vanc/Zosyn/Cipro.
   Response:
   Lung sounds remains clear overnight. Slight decrease in oral secretions
   as shift progressed. Increasing Fentanyl from 25 to 50 mcg/hr with no
   apparent effect on respiratory rate or pattern, MICU team declined
   offer of ABG by RRT.
   [**Name (NI) 99**]:
   [**Name2 (NI) 8681**] IV antibiotics. Continue VAP protocol. Cont to monitor ABG
   as obtained by RRT/MD
s (no ALine).
   Diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   Patient with a history of DM
   Action:
   Monitored evening BG level: low at 54 (@ 2300).
   Response:
   Administered
 amp D50%. Re-check BG level 95 by midnight. 06 am level:
   84.
   Plan:
   Continue close monitoring of BG levels. ? mixing IV antibiotics in
   dextrose.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   -Skin with finely cracked & flaky areas found on most areas of
   patient
s body; sites not bleeding or oozing. Sloughing off especially
   notable in bilateral hands/fingers & feet/toes, also groin folds.
   - Skin tear on left cheek (? At site of old ETT tape), also some oral
   blisters.
   -Received patient with skin well-moisturized, so it did not appear dry
   during assessment. Patient
s entire back with pink/red hue that
   blanches; difficult to assess level of redness given patient
s race.
   -Large heart-shaped mepilex dressing (placed [**8-5**]) found intact &
   covering coccyx/upper bilateral gluteal area was not removed.
   -Patient with 4-6 + pitting edema from shoulders to toes, marked in
   bilateral hands & LE
s to feet.
   -Family reports pt had a rash within the past two weeks for which the
   initial treatment appeared to worsen the general condition of her skin.
   Action:
   Turned patient q 2 hours with frequent application of aloe vesta cream.
   Maintained MP boots. Mepilex dressing monitored for integrity.
   Bilateral arms/hands elevated to attempt to diminish edema. Cleansing
   bath. ETT re-positioned & re- taped by RRT.
   Response:
   [**Name2 (NI) **] worsening or deterioration noted in general skin condition. Remains
   with generalized edema. Mepilex dressing intact. Tolerating turning and
   repositioning.
   Plan:
   Continue skin care including turning and repositioning, application of
   aloe-vesta cream as well as MP boots, elevate extremities as
   appropriate. Monitor integrity of mepilex dressing, to be changed on
   day # 3.
